questionTitle: Which of the following should be replaced with question mark in the figure shown below?
questionExplanation: Voice over IP or VoIP is a set of communication protocols for delivering voice over the Internet.

questionOption1: SHOUTcast is best known for its SHOUTcast Radio
questionOption2: SHOUTcast is a proprietary server solution for streaming media on the Internet
questionOption3: NPR started out providing RealAudio files for streaming and then added Windows Media files as a second format
questionExplanation: National Public Radio is a very good example of how audio streaming has evolved.

questionTitle: Which of the following is the most commonly used VoIP standard?
questionExplanation: IMS stands for IP Multimedia Subsystem.

questionTitle: Which of the following is more light weight protocol among listed below?
questionExplanation: MGCP stands for Media Gateway Control Protocol.

questionOption1: H.323 is used on short transmission lines
questionOption2: POTS is also referred to as the Public Switched Telephone Network (PSTN)
questionOption3: The ITU-T is the standards body for PSTN
questionExplanation: H.323 is used on short transmission lines.

questionTitle: The Skype protocol is a proprietary (closed-source) protocol, parts of which use the Global Index ______ protocol.
questionExplanation: Skype uses the peer-to-peer model that was based on Kazaa.

questionTitle: Which of the following encryption method or algorithm is used in Skype communication?
questionExplanation: Skype communication is encrypted using standard encryption methods.

questionTitle: Which of the following feature is supported by Skype application?
questionExplanation: Skype is perhaps the most widely used telephony application in the world.

questionTitle: How many streaming services does Google have which uses VoIP protocols?
questionExplanation: Google has two streaming services that use VoIP protocols: Google Talk and Google Voice.

questionTitle: Google Talk is a service that uses the ______ protocol for the Google Chat IM client.
questionExplanation: Google Voice is Googleâ€™s telephony application, which is also a VoIP service.
